author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Robinson releases ‘Ragtime’
text:
Robinson releases ‘Ragtime’ Oct 25, 2015 
Alna — Medomak Valley High School grad Aaron Robinson has released “Max Morath: Complete Ragtime Works for Piano,” a Music at Immanuel CD. 
Robinson, who directed many Midcoast choral and musical theater productions and served a number of years as musical director, choirmaster and organist at Portland’s Immanuel Baptist Church, is a historian and author, as well as performer and composer. Moraht was an American ragtime pianist, composer, actor, radio and television personality and author credited for the ragtime revival in the 1970s. Morath wrote, performed and co-produced 26 half-hour television programs for PBS before taking Broadway by storm with his one-man shows “Max Morath at the Turn of the Century,” “The Ragtime Years,” “Living a Ragtime Life,” “The Ragtime Man,” “Ragtime Revisited” and “Ragtime and Again.” 
Robinson’s album is available as both an audio CD and digital download from Amazon.com, where its tracks can be sampled. In the first week since its Oct. 15th release, the album made it to the No. 60 spot on iTune’s Top 100 Jazz New Releases.
